template.name: Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2
template.description: Template Server HP iLO version: 0.15 Overview: for HP iLO adapters that support SNMP get. Or via operating system, using SNMP HP subagent MIBs used: CPQSINFO-MIB CPQHLTH-MIB CPQIDA-MIB

item.name: System: Temperature status
item.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB This value specifies the overall condition of the system's thermal environment. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Temperature could not be determined. ok(2) The temperature sensor is within normal operating range. degraded(3) The temperature sensor is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) The temperature sensor detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.

item.name: Overall system health status
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The overall condition. This object represents the overall status of the server information represented by this MIB.

item.name: Hardware model name
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The machine product name.The name of the machine used in this system.

item.name: Hardware serial number
item.description: MIB: CPQSINFO-MIB The serial number of the physical system unit. The string will be empty if the system does not report the serial number function.

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: {#SNMPINDEX}

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature sensor location
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB This specifies the location of the temperature sensor present in the system.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"{#SNMPINDEX}"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#SNMPINDEX}"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is too low: <{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"{#SNMPINDEX}"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery Ambient
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with ambient(11) and 0.1 index filter

item_prototype.name: Ambient: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: Ambient

trigger_prototype.name: Ambient: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Ambient"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: Ambient: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Ambient"}

trigger_prototype.name: Ambient: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Ambient"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: Ambient: Temperature is too low: <{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"Ambient"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.

discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with cpu(6) filter

item_prototype.name: CPU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: CPU-{#SNMPINDEX}

trigger_prototype.name: CPU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: CPU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}

trigger_prototype.name: CPU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: CPU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is too low: <{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.

discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with memory(7) filter

item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: Memory-{#SNMPINDEX}

trigger_prototype.name: Memory-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Memory"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with powerSupply(10) filter

item_prototype.name: PSU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: PSU-{#SNMPINDEX}

trigger_prototype.name: PSU-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"PSU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with ioBoard(5) filter

item_prototype.name: I/O-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: I/O-{#SNMPINDEX}

trigger_prototype.name: I/O-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"I/O"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: I/O-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"I/O"}

trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery System
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Temperature Sensor Entries: CPQHLTH-MIB::cpqHeTemperatureTable with system(3) filter

item_prototype.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB Temperature readings of testpoint: System-{#SNMPINDEX}

trigger_prototype.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Device"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}

trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: System-{#SNMPINDEX}: Temperature is too low: <{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"Device"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}.

item_prototype.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The condition of the power supply. This value will be one of the following: other(1) The status could not be determined or not present. ok(2) The power supply is operating normally. degraded(3) A temperature sensor, fan or other power supply component is outside of normal operating range. failed(4) A power supply component detects a condition that could permanently damage the system.

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the power supply unit for errors

trigger_prototype.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the power supply unit for errors

dependency.name: Chassis {#CHASSIS_NUM}, bay {#BAY_NUM}: Power supply is in critical state

item_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQHLTH-MIB The condition of the fan. This value will be one of the following: other(1) Fan status detection is not supported by this system or driver. ok(2) The fan is operating properly. degraded(2) A redundant fan is not operating properly. failed(4) A non-redundant fan is not operating properly.

trigger_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the fan unit

trigger_prototype.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the fan unit

dependency.name: Fan {#SNMPINDEX}: Fan is in critical state

discovery_rule.name: Array Controller Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Array controllers: CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaCntlrTable

item_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB This value represents the overall condition of this controller, and any associated logical drives,physical drives, and array accelerators.

item_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller model
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Array Controller Model. The type of controller card.

trigger_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: {#CNTLR_LOCATION}: Disk array controller is in critical state

discovery_rule.name: Array Controller Cache Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of Array controllers: CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaAccelTable

item_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Cache Module/Operations Status. This describes the status of the cache module and/or cache operations. Note that for some controller models, a cache module board that physically attaches to the controller or chipset may not be an available option.

item_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Cache Module Board Backup Power Status. This monitors the status of each backup power source on the board. The backup power source can only recharge when the system has power applied. The type of backup power source used is indicated by cpqDaAccelBackupPowerSource. The following values are valid: Other (1) Indicates that the instrument agent does not recognize backup power status. You may need to update your software.
Ok (2) The backup power source is fully charged.
Recharging (3) The array controller has one or more cache module backup power sources that are recharging. Cache module operations such as Battery/Flash Backed Write Cache, Expansion, Extension and Migration are temporarily suspended until the backup power source is fully charged. Cache module operations will automatically resume when charging is complete.
Failed (4) The battery pack is below the sufficient voltage level and has not recharged in 36 hours. Your Cache Module board needs to be serviced.
Degraded (5) The battery is still operating, however, one of the batteries in the pack has failed to recharge properly. Your Cache Module board should be serviced as soon as possible.
NotPresent (6) A backup power source is not present on the cache module board. Some controllers do not have backup power sources.
Capacitor Failed (7) The flash backed cache module capacitor is below the sufficient voltage level and has not recharged in 10 minutes. Your Cache Module board needs to be serviced.

trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in critical state!
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"invalid"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"cacheModDegradedFailsafeSpeed"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"cacheReadCacheNotMapped"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"cacheModFlashMemNotAttached"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in critical state!

trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is not in optimal state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in critical state!
#{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller is in warning state
dependency.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"invalid"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"cacheModDegradedFailsafeSpeed"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"cacheReadCacheNotMapped"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.status[cpqDaAccelStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_WARN_STATUS:"cacheModFlashMemNotAttached"},eq)}=1

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:"failed"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:"capacitorFailed"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery is in critical state!
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for faults

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_WARN_STATUS:"degraded"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_WARN_STATUS:"notPresent"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for faults

dependency.name: #{#CACHE_CNTRL_INDEX}: Disk array cache controller battery is in critical state!
dependency.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:"failed"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.diskarray.cache.battery.status[cpqDaAccelBattery.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_ARRAY_CACHE_BATTERY_CRIT_STATUS:"capacitorFailed"},eq)}=1

discovery_rule.name: Physical Disk Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Scanning table of physical drive entries CPQIDA-MIB::cpqDaPhyDrvTable.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Status. This shows the status of the physical drive. The following values are valid for the physical drive status: other (1) Indicates that the instrument agent does not recognize the drive. You may need to upgrade your instrument agent and/or driver software. ok (2) Indicates the drive is functioning properly. failed (3) Indicates that the drive is no longer operating and should be replaced. predictiveFailure(4) Indicates that the drive has a predictive failure error and should be replaced.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk S.M.A.R.T. status
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive S.M.A.R.T Status.The following values are defined: other(1) The agent is unable to determine if the status of S.M.A.R.T predictive failure monitoring for this drive. ok(2) Indicates the drive is functioning properly. replaceDrive(3) Indicates that the drive has a S.M.A.R.T predictive failure error and should be replaced.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Serial Number. This is the serial number assigned to the physical drive. This value is based upon the serial number as returned by the SCSI inquiry command but may have been modified due to space limitations. This can be used for identification purposes.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Model.This is a text description of the physical drive. The text that appears depends upon who manufactured the drive and the drive type. If a drive fails, note the model to identify the type of drive necessary for replacement. If a model number is not present, you may not have properly initialized the drive array to which the physical drive is attached for monitoring.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk media type
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Drive Array Physical Drive Media Type.The following values are defined: other(1) The instrument agent is unable to determine the physical drive’s media type. rotatingPlatters(2) The physical drive media is composed of rotating platters. solidState(3) The physical drive media is composed of solid state electronics.

item_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk size
item_prototype.description: MIB: CPQIDA-MIB Physical Drive Size in MB. This is the size of the physical drive in megabytes. This value is calculated using the value 1,048,576 (2^20) as a megabyte. Drive manufacturers sometimes use the number 1,000,000 as a megabyte when giving drive capacities so this value may differ from the advertised size of a drive. This field is only applicable for controllers which support SCSI drives, and therefore is not supported by the IDA or IDA-2 controllers. The field will contain 0xFFFFFFFF if the drive capacity cannot be calculated or if the controller does not support SCSI drives.

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk failed
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check physical disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[cpqDaPhyDrvSmartStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_SMART_FAIL_STATUS:"replaceDrive"},eq)}=1 or {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.smart_status[cpqDaPhyDrvSmartStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].count(#1,{$DISK_SMART_FAIL_STATUS:"replaceDriveSSDWearOut"},eq)}=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Physical disk S.M.A.R.T. failed
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Disk probably requires replacement.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cpqDaPhyDrvSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1 and {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.physicaldisk.serialnumber[cpqDaPhyDrvSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}].strlen()}>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#DISK_LOCATION}: Disk has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Disk serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Status
item_prototype.description: Logical Drive Status.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Layout type
item_prototype.description: Logical Drive Fault Tolerance. This shows the fault tolerance mode of the logical drive.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Disk size
item_prototype.description: Logical Drive Size. This is the size of the logical drive in megabytes. This value is calculated using the value 1,048,576 (2^20) as a megabyte. Drive manufacturers sometimes use the number 1,000,000 as a megabyte when giving drive capacities so this value may differ from the advertised size of a drive.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Virtual disk failed
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check virtual disk for warnings or errors

trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX}({#DISK_NAME}): Virtual disk is not in OK state
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check virtual disk for warnings or errors

trigger.name: System status is in critical state
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for errors

trigger.name: System status is in warning state
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Please check the device for warnings

dependency.name: System status is in critical state

trigger.expression: {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.diff()}=1 and {Template Server HP iLO SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Device serial number has changed. Ack to close
